meaningMnemonic:
You <kanji>divide</kanji> something into different <kanji>type</kanji>s. That's called <vocabulary>classification</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>categorization</vocabulary>.

分類 is a relatively formal word that refers to the act of classifying or categorizing items, organisms, or information into specific groups based on shared characteristics or criteria.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
